title: Assessment of green technology innovation on energy-environmental efficiency in China under the influence of ... - Nature.com
summary: The article examines the spatial autocorrelation analysis of various variables related to energy efficiency and green technology innovation in China from 2003 to 2017, focusing on the impact of green technology innovation (GTI) on energy efficiency (EEE) under the influence of emission reduction policies (ER). The results suggest a significant positive spatial correlation among provinces for energy efficiency, green technology innovation, and emission reduction, with evidence of a U-shaped relationship between GTI and EEE. The study also decomposes GTI into SubGI and SymGI to analyze their impact on EEE, highlighting the importance of new clean energy technologies in enhancing energy efficiency.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the development and impact of green technology innovation and emission reduction policies to enhance energy efficiency, addressing environmental sustainability goals by reducing carbon emissions and promoting green technologies.
business_innovation: FALSE. The focus of the article is on green technology innovation and emission reduction policies to improve energy efficiency, rather than solely on general business innovation.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not specifically highlight the creation of a new physical product or service but focuses on green technology innovation and its impact on energy efficiency.
green_process: TRUE. The article discusses adopting green processes in terms of emission reduction policies and green technology innovation to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability in operational activities.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 22 - Utilities, 54 - Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services, 56 - Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services, 92 - Public Administration

green_innovation: TRUE, The article discusses updated energy efficiency standards for social housing, contributing to environmental sustainability goals such as reducing energy consumption and transitioning to clean heating systems.
business_innovation: FALSE, The article focuses on energy efficiency standards and clean heating systems for social housing, which may not align with a new or significantly improved product or business process.
green_product: TRUE, The article discusses the introduction of energy-efficient standards and clean heating systems in social housing, which are designed to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout the products' life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, The article highlights the implementation of green processes in social housing, aiming to minimize environmental impacts by reducing energy consumption, waste, and transitioning to clean heating alternatives.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 236118 - Residential remodelers, 221121 - Electric Bulk Power Transmission and Control, 236210 - Industrial Building Construction, 234930 - Industrial Non-residential building construction
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not involve making false or misleading claims about environmental benefits; it focuses on implementing energy efficiency standards and clean heating systems in social housing.

title: Suffolk Building Society launches new eco self-build product - Financial Reporter
summary: Suffolk Building Society introduces a new eco self-build mortgage product aimed at incentivizing energy-efficient property construction by offering reduced rates and fees to borrowers and renovators.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is a green innovation as the new eco self-build mortgage product encourages the construction of energy-efficient properties, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of a new eco self-build mortgage product represents a business innovation for Suffolk Building Society as it differs significantly from its previous products, offering specific benefits and terms tailored to promote energy-efficient property construction.
green_product: TRUE: The eco self-build mortgage product can be classified as a green product as it is designed to significantly reduce the environmental impact throughout the life cycle of the constructed properties by promoting energy efficiency and the use of qualifying energy-efficient features.
green_process: FALSE: The article focuses on a green product, the eco self-build mortgage, rather than describing a specific green process in manufacturing, production, or operational activities.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 522291 - Consumer Lending, 522292 - Real Estate Credit, 522390 - Other Credit Intermediation, 522310 - Mortgage and Nonmortgage Loan Brokers
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it transparently presents the features and benefits of the eco self-build mortgage product without deceptive environmental claims.

title: Goldmedal Electricals Unveils New Line-up of Stylish, Energy-Efficient Water Heaters - CIO News
summary: Goldmedal Electricals introduces a new range of water heaters, emphasizing technology advancement, energy efficiency, and customer satisfaction.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as the new range of water heaters emphasizes superior efficiency, energy efficiency, and eco-friendly insulation materials, aligning with environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. This is business innovation as Goldmedal Electricals is expanding its product portfolio with a new range of water heaters, introducing a product category that differs significantly from its previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE. This is a green product as the water heaters are designed to be energy-efficient, use corrosion-resistant and eco-friendly materials, and offer multiple safety features, all aimed at reducing environmental impact throughout the product life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. This is a green process as the manufacturing and production of the water heaters incorporate design features like efficient insulation materials, energy-efficient technologies, and safety features to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
